maths package#

Submodules#

maths.calcs module#

This module contains functions with the logic for all mathematical calculations used in the programme. All functions take in floats and return floats rounded to 2 decimal places.

maths.calcs.annual_from_monthly(monthly_amount)[source]#

This function calculates a monthly amount over a year

Parameters:

monthly_amount – amount per month

Returns:

amount per year

Return type:

float

maths.calcs.annual_from_weekly(weekly_amount)[source]#

This function calculates an annual amount from a weekly amount

Parameters:

weekly_amount – amount per week

Returns:

amount per annum

Return type:

float

maths.calcs.difference(small_num, big_num)[source]#

This function calculates the difference between two values

Parameters:

  • num1 – float number

  • num2 – float number

Returns:

difference between num1 and num2

Return type:

float

maths.calcs.get_average_amount(spending_list)[source]#

This function takes in a list of values. It appends the first number in the list to a new list. It then calculates the mean of the first two numbers, then first three and so on. It then returns the list of cumulative averages.

Parameters:

spending_list – list of floats

Returns:

cumulative averages for each item in list

Return type:

list

maths.calcs.get_mean(numbers_list)[source]#

This function calculates the mean from a list of numbers

Parameters:

numbers_list – list of numbers

Returns:

mean of the numbers in the list

Return type:

float

maths.calcs.get_month_from_year(amount)[source]#

This function takes in an amount over an annual term and returns the amount for one month

Parameters:

amount – amount over a year

Returns:

amount over a month

Return type:

float

maths.calcs.get_week_from_year(amount)[source]#

This function takes in an amount over an annual term and returns the amount for one week

Parameters:

amount – amount over a year

Returns:

amount of money over a week

Return type:

float

maths.calcs.total_spending(amount_list)[source]#

This function calculates the total from a list of amounts

Parameters:

amount_list – list of float amounts

Returns:

sum of all amounts in list

Return type:

float

maths.graphs module#

This module plots a graph to show progress in a financial goal. For a budget; it plots a scatter graph with the total spending for each week in the year so far, it draws a line of best fit for the cumulative average spending for each week and it draws a horizontal line for the target budget. Similarly, for gross or net income it plots income in a scatter graph, draws a line showing the cumulative average income for each week and a horizontal line showing the target income.

maths.graphs.make_plot(common_args, goal_args, labels)[source]#

This function plots a graph to show progress in a financial goal

Parameters:

  • common_args – tuple with arguments common to all goals

  • goal_args – tuple with goal-specific arguments

  • labels – tuple with strings for labels relevant to goal

Returns:

None
